body_html:
@sgarcia22 could you attach a stack trace?

You can also try the caffe2-gcc4.8 package, which is built with protobuf from conda-forge.

If it is protobuf related then installing from source should fix it. You'd only have to install onnx from source. I'd recommend something like

conda create -yn caffe2 python=3 && source activate caffe2
conda install -yc caffe2 caffe2

# Download this source wherever you want
git clone https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git --recursive

# Install onnx from source
cd pytorch
PROTOBUF_INCDIR=/path/to/anaconda/envs/caffe2 pip install third_party/onnx

body:
@sgarcia22 could you attach a stack trace?

You can also try the caffe2-gcc4.8 package, which is built with protobuf from conda-forge.

If it is protobuf related then installing from source should fix it. You'd only have to install onnx from source. I'd recommend something like
```
conda create -yn caffe2 python=3 && source activate caffe2
conda install -yc caffe2 caffe2

# Download this source wherever you want
git clone https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git --recursive

# Install onnx from source
cd pytorch
PROTOBUF_INCDIR=/path/to/anaconda/envs/caffe2 pip install third_party/onnx
```
